title: Cell Structure and Organelles
content_html:
Cell Structure and Organelles

All living organisms are composed of cells, which are the basic structural and functional units of life.

Cell Theory

  • All living things are composed of cells
  • Cells are the basic units of structure and function
  • New cells arise from existing cells

Major Organelles

  • Nucleus: Contains genetic material (DNA)
  • Mitochondria: Powerhouse of the cell, produces ATP
  • Endoplasmic Reticulum: Protein synthesis and transport
  • Golgi Apparatus: Protein modification and packaging
  • Ribosomes: Protein synthesis

mcqs.question: Which organelle is known as the powerhouse of the cell?
mcqs.explanation: Mitochondria are called the powerhouse of the cell because they produce ATP through cellular respiration.

mcqs.question: What is the function of ribosomes?
mcqs.explanation: Ribosomes are responsible for protein synthesis by translating mRNA into proteins.
